intro: Gnaphalium maculatum, commonly known as the spotted everlasting, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are often surrounded by bracts that give it a distinctive appearance. Gnaphalium maculatum is known for its aromatic foliage and is often used in dried flower arrangements due to its long-lasting nature. It thrives in well-drained soils and is commonly found in meadows and along roadsides.
